purpose: The code appears to collect MAC addresses from network interfaces, encode them in base64, and send tracking data to external domains via HTTP requests.
flows: MAC addresses from os.networkInterfaces() -> Buffer.from() -> base64 encoding -> http.request()
anomalies: Use of hardcoded C2 domains in array _tmp_2
Sending system information (hostname, user info) to external domains
analysis: The code collects system identifiers including MAC addresses, hostname, and user information. These identifiers are then sent to hardcoded external domains via unverified HTTPS requests. This behavior is consistent with tracking or exfiltration functionality commonly associated with malware or surveillance tools.
conclusion: The code exhibits malicious behavior by collecting system identifiers and sending them to external domains without proper authorization or encryption verification.
